metadata.name: The Black House • Spring • I-IV
metadata.description: Scientifically, black refers to black holes and nothingness. In optics, black absorbs all wavelengths and is therefore characterized by its apparent absence of color, unlike white which is obtained by returning all the wavelengths it absorbs in equal parts. In the West, black is associated with mourning, sadness and despair, fear and death. Behind this dark side, black also offers another face, associated with elegance and simplicity.
